name: North American Indian Center of Boston (NAICOB)
description: NAICOB offers advocacy services with a licensed social worker and attorney available by appointment to assist with issues relating to homelessness, housing, the Indian Child Welfare Act (ICWA), education, substance abuse, domestic violence, and other legal needs
services: Alaska-Native-owned Legal aid in Massachusetts consultation

name: Massachusetts Legal Assistance Corporation (MLAC)
description: MLAC is the largest funding source for civil legal aid organizations in Massachusetts, working to ensure low-income individuals have access to legal information, advice, and representation
services: Alaska-Native-owned Legal aid in Massachusetts consultation

name: Community Legal Aid (CLA)
address: Multiple offices in Western and Central MA, including:
description: CLA provides free civil legal aid to residents of Central and Western Massachusetts, covering areas such as housing, family law, and public benefits
services: Alaska-Native-owned Legal aid in Massachusetts consultation

name: Northeast Legal Aid (NLA)
address: Multiple offices in Northeast Massachusetts, including:
description: NLA offers free civil legal services to low-income and elderly individuals and families in Northeast Massachusetts, covering a range of civil legal issues
services: Alaska-Native-owned Legal aid in Massachusetts consultation

name: Harvard Legal Aid Bureau
description: A law student program with attorney supervision, providing free legal services to low-income individuals in Massachusetts
services: Alaska-Native-owned Legal aid in Massachusetts consultation

name: Legal Services Center of Harvard Law School
description: Another law student program with attorney supervision, offering legal assistance to low-income individuals
services: Alaska-Native-owned Legal aid in Massachusetts consultation

name: Volunteer Lawyers Project (VLP)
description: VLP provides free legal assistance to low-income residents of Massachusetts through a network of volunteer attorneys
services: Alaska-Native-owned Legal aid in Massachusetts consultation

name: MassLegalHelp
address: Not a physical location, but a resource website
description: This website provides free, practical information about legal rights in Massachusetts, compiled by legal aid programs. It can help users understand their options and find resources
services: Alaska-Native-owned Legal aid in Massachusetts consultation

name: Native American Law Lawyers in Massachusetts (Directory)
description: This is a directory of Native American Law lawyers in Massachusetts. While not a legal aid service, it lists attorneys who specialize in Native American law and may be able to assist individuals or tribes
services: Alaska-Native-owned Legal aid in Massachusetts consultation

name: Alaska Legal Services Corporation (ALSC)
address: While ALSC is based in Alaska and serves Alaska Natives, they do not have offices in Massachusetts. However, they are a significant resource for Alaska Native legal issues
description: ALSC provides free civil legal assistance to Alaskans in need, including Alaska Natives, on issues such as family law, housing, public benefits, and Alaska Native law. They may be able to offer guidance or referrals for those in Massachusetts with specific Alaska Native legal concerns
services: Alaska-Native-owned Legal aid in Massachusetts consultation
